aicpa-topic.title: Control Risk and Timing of Procedures

body.p: 11.38 Control risk has been assessed as low or moderate for certain assertions and as high for others:

li.p:
Control risk as low or moderate. For the assertions about existence or occurrence, completeness, and rights and obligations, control risk will be assessed as low or moderate. This is considered the most effective and efficient approach, given the controls in place, such as the performance of reconciliations and monitoring of hedge effectiveness. Tests of details of the recording of transactions in the general ledger in accordance with FASB ASC 815 and confirmation procedures will take place prior to year-end. At year-end, various reconciliations, significant activity, and hedge effectiveness will be reviewed, and the continuance of controls tested will be reviewed through inquiry and observation. Paragraph .18 of AU-C section 330B, Performing Audit Procedures in Response to Assessed Risks and Evaluating the Audit Evidence Obtained,
All AU-C sections can be found in AICPA Professional Standards AICPA Professional Standards .
states that irrespective of the assessed risk of material misstatements, the auditor should design and perform substantive procedures for all relevant assertions related to each material class of transactions, account balance, and disclosure.
Each AU-C section in this guide designated with a “B” suffix (for example, “AU-C section 200B”) denotes content that does not reflect the codification of Statement on Auditing Standards (SAS) Nos. 134–140 or the amendments to other SASs made by SAS Nos. 134–140 and subsequently issued SASs.
Because effective internal controls generally reduce but do not eliminate risk of material misstatement, tests of controls reduce but do not eliminate the need for substantive procedures.
Paragraph .A9 of AU-C section 330B, Performing Audit Procedures in Response to Assessed Risks and Evaluating the Audit Evidence Obtained.
In addition, analytical procedures alone may not be sufficient in some cases.

Control risk as high. For the assertions about valuation and presentation and disclosure, control risk is assessed as high due to the efficiency with which the valuation of derivatives at year-end can be tested. Also, adequacy of presentation and disclosure can only be assessed at year-end.
